summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 23, 2019. It documents operational issues, staff assignments, and inmate statuses, most notably recording that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch. The report also includes institutional population totals and administrative leave/overtime data.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 who was placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, as documented in the MCC New York Daily Activity Report.

persons.name: Burnett
persons.context: Inmate #406254-054 noted as being at a local hospice under USMS guard supervision.

persons.name: Cooper
persons.context: Inmate #85972-054 who was both newly admitted to and released from MCC New York on the same day, per the report.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was placed on suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
Local Hospice (where inmate Burnett was located)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was placed on suicide watch at MCC New York on July 23, 2019.
The report documents operational issues including an inoperative control panel for ES/GS Main Door/Fire Exit doors and an inoperative inner gate.
A 'Fire Watch' was in progress, and staffing shortages led to vacated correctional officer assignments.
The total inmate population at MCC New York at the beginning of the morning watch shift on July 23, 2019, was 776.
The report is a routine administrative log but gains historical significance due to its documentation of Epstein's status shortly before his death.
